DataElement.preferredName: Pediatric EAT-10 10 Swallowing Is Stressful for Child Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Parent's stated response about the problem severity of swallowing is stressful for their child, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pediatric Eating Assessment Tool-10 Swallowing Is Stressful for Child Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pediatric version of the Eating Assessment Tool-10, designed to allow a parent to report their child's swallowing difficulties.:A question about whether swallowing is stressful for an individual's child._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A ten question measure designed to assess swallowing difficulties._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 0 on a problem severity scale that ranges from 0: No problem to 4: Severe problem.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Swallowing is stressful for my child.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
